scipy_vision_tools module¶

scipy_vision_tools.applySegmentationSteps(input_img, input_mode, output_root, save_intermediate=False, overwrite=False)¶

This is a convenience function to apply all my vision steps in one go.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • output_root (str) – The filepath to the directory where outputs will be created.

  • save_intermediate (bool) – Flag to save intermediate outputs to disk, defaults to False.

  • overwrite (bool) – Flag to overwrite existing outputs, defaults to False.

Returns

Returns 0 if output successfully created, otherwise returns 1.

Return type

int

scipy_vision_tools.calculatePixelMetrics(input_img, input_df)¶

Calculates pixel metrics for every detection in a dataframe.

Parameters

  • input_img (str) – Filepath to the input img

  • input_df (pandas dataframe) – Dataframe with detections

Returns

Returns the dataframe augmented with pixel metrics.

Return type

pandas dataframe

scipy_vision_tools.calculatePixelMetricsMP(input_img, input_df, num_workers=8)¶

A multiproessing pixel metrics implementation.

Parameters

  • input_img (str) – Filepath to the input img

  • input_df (pandas dataframe) – Dataframe with detections

  • num_workers (int) – Number of workers to assign, defaults to 8.

Returns

Returns the dataframe augmented with pixel metrics.

Return type

pandas dataframe

scipy_vision_tools.calculatePixelMetricsQueue(q, input_img, input_df, output_list)¶

This is a queue for multiprocessing.

Parameters

  • q (Multiprocessing.Queue object) – the queue generated by calculatePixelMetricsMP

  • input_img (str) – Filepath to the input img

  • input_df (pandas dataframe) – Dataframe with detections

  • output_list (Multiprocessing.Manager object) – a Manager generated by calculatePixelMetricsMP

scipy_vision_tools.calculateTrimOffsetBackward(input_arr, threshold=0)¶
This function is used to calculate the offset of the lower right corner

after trimming. The threshold should be the same as whatever is used in trim2DArray. Returns the x and y of the lower right corner.

Parameters

input_arr –

A 2D numpy array to be trimmed. :type input_arr: numpy array :param threshold: Any exterior row or column with a total less than or equal to threshold will be removed, defaults to 0. :type threshold: int or float

return

Returns the x and y of the lower right corner.

rtype

int, int

scipy_vision_tools.calculateTrimOffsetForward(input_arr, threshold=0)¶
This function is used to calculate the offset of the upper left corner

after trimming. The threshold should be the same as whatever is used in trim2DArray.

Parameters

  • input_arr (numpy array) – A 2D numpy array to be trimmed.

  • threshold (int or float) – Any exterior row or column with a total less than or equal to threshold will be removed, defaults to 0.

Returns

Returns the x and y of the upper left corner.

Return type

int, int

scipy_vision_tools.circleMask(img, cir_x, cir_y, r, mode, filter=0)¶

Takes an img (loaded as a np array), the x and y coordinates to center the mask, the radius of the mask, and the mode. Mode must be interior or exterior. The default filter value is 0. https://towardsdatascience.com/the-little-known-ogrid-function-in-numpy-19ead3bdae40

Parameters

  • input_img (numpy array) – An image loaded as a numpy array.

  • cir_x (int) – The x coordinate of the center of the circle.

  • cir_y (int) – The y coordinate of the center of the circle.

  • r (int) – The radius of the circle mask

  • mode (str) – Determines what is inside and outside the mask. Must be interior or exterior

  • filter (int or float) – The value for pixels outside the mask, defaults to 0.

Returns

Returns True if the image is too small to be a valid cluster, otherwise False.

Return type

bool

scipy_vision_tools.connectedComponentsImage(input_img, input_mode, connectivity=1, output_path=None)¶

Applies connected components labelling to an input image.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • connectivity (int) – Controls the distance to connect components, defaults to 1.

  • output_path (str, optional) – The filepath of the image to be saved.

Returns

Returns numpy array with the connected components.

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.countPixels(input_img, input_mode, x, y, r)¶

Counts pixels within a radius around x, y.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • x (int) – The x coordinate of the center of the circle.

  • y (int) – The y coordinate of the center of the circle.

  • r (int) – The radius around the center of the circle

Returns

Returns the number of pixels.

Return type

int

scipy_vision_tools.edgeDetection(input_img, input_mode, sigma=1, output_path=None)¶
Takes either a string to an image or a np array as input and an integer

for sigma. Default settings are for thresholded images.Supported input modes are: “np” (numpy array) or “fp” (filepath). Returns an image of edge detections. If output path is applied, the edge raster will be saved.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • sigma (int) – Controls the scale of edge detection, defaults to 1.

  • output_path (str, optional) – The filepath of the image to be saved.

Returns

Returns numpy array of transformed image

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.exportBlobs(input_img, input_blobs, input_mode, output_root)¶

Input_img and input_blobs will be opened with identical modes. Output is a directory containing base and blobs subdirectories. Base has the mask for each blob applied to the image.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_img – Either the filepath to the input blobs (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • output_root (str) – The filepath to the directory where clusters will be saved.

Returns

Returns 0 upon completion.

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.getDistanceRaster(input_img, input_mode, output_path=None)¶

Takes a string containing the file path to the input image and an optional string with the desired output filepath. Returns a np array with the distance transform applied. If output path is applied, the distance raster will be saved. Note: the logical not is necessary for the scipy function. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44770396/how-does-the-scipy-distance-transform-edt-function-work

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • output_path (str, optional) – The filepath of the image to be saved.

Returns

Returns numpy array of transformed image

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.getImageThreshold(input_img, input_mode, threshold, output_path=None)¶
Takes either a string to an image or a np array as input and a float

for thresholding. Supported input modes are: “np” (numpy array) or “fp” (filepath). Returns a thresholded image. If output path is applied, the thresholded raster will be saved.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • threshold (int or float) – The comparison value for thresholding.

  • output_path (str, optional) – The filepath of the image to be saved.

Returns

Returns numpy array of transformed image

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.morphologicalCloseImage(input_img, input_mode, stel=50, output_path=None)¶
Takes either a string to an image or a np array as input and an integer

for structuring element. Applies a circular structuring element. Supported input modes are: “np” (numpy array) or “fp” (filepath). Returns an image with a closing appplied. If output path is applied, the closed raster will be saved.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • stel (int) – Controls the size of structuring element, defaults to 50.

  • output_path (str, optional) – The filepath of the image to be saved.

Returns

Returns numpy array of transformed image

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.ridgeDetection(input_img, input_mode, method='meijering', black_ridges=False, output_path=None)¶

Applies ridge detection to an input image.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • method (str) – Ridge detection algorithm, defaults to meijering.

  • black_ridges (bool) – Controls whether black or white pixels are the ridges, defaults to False (white pixels = ridge).

  • output_path (str, optional) – The filepath of the image to be saved.

Returns

Returns numpy array with the connected components.

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.saveImage(np_img, output_path, mode=None, scale=255.0)¶

Takes a np array as input and saves it to output path using PIL. Current supported modes are: dist_norm - distance normalization I use for distance transforms blob_labels - 255 scaling I use for connected components

Parameters

  • np_img (numpy array) – The numpy array to be saved

  • output_path (str) – The filepath of the image to be saved.

  • mode (str) – There are two convenience modes: ‘dist_norm’ (distance transform normalization) and ‘blob_labels’ (blob labelling), defaults to None.

  • scale (int or float) – Value used for scaling in distance normalization, defaults to 255.0

Returns

Returns the image loaded as a numpy array.

Return type

numpy array

scipy_vision_tools.testVerySmallClusters(input_img, input_mode, min_rad=7.5)¶
This functions takes a cluster as input and tests if its biggest

circle would be too small. Returns True if it’s smaller and False if it’s bigger.

Parameters

  • input_img (str or numpy array) – Either the filepath to the input img (input_mode=’fp’) or a numpy array (input_mode=’np’).

  • input_mode (str) – ‘fp’ if input_img is a filepath or ‘np’ if input_img is a numpy array.

  • min_rad (int or float) – the minimum radius for a valid cluster, defaults to 7.5

Returns

Returns True if the image is too small to be a valid cluster, otherwise False.

Return type

bool

scipy_vision_tools.trim2DArray(input_arr, threshold=0)¶
Convenience function to trim a 2D array. Removes any rows/columns

with values equal to or less than the threshold. Source: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11188364/remove-zero-lines-2-d-numpy-array?utm_medium=organic&utm_source=google_rich_qa&utm_campaign=google_rich_qa

Parameters

  • input_arr (numpy array) – A 2D numpy array to be trimmed.

  • threshold (int or float) – Any exterior row or column with a total less than or equal to threshold will be removed, defaults to 0.

Returns

Returns a subset of the input array.

Return type

numpy array
